comments.body: Hi @regineheberlein -- Sara says she will give me the correct language by the end of this week. I wanted to check, for the 50-some statements in mss and TC that are unique, can you leave them OUT of the bulk update, or do you need to update ALL and then re-input the unique statements with a spreadsheet that contains each unique statement? Thanks!

Hi @phoebeno ,

we can do it either way. Both methods require that you give me a list of the 50+ "special" collections, either to leave out of the first iteration or to treat differently in the same go. But if the question is whether the 50 special ones are necessarily holding up the project, then the answer is no--we can do the others first and then come back to these!

lib_jobs.title: Mermaid charts should have accessible names and descriptions

comments.body:
- [x] Investigate the current workflow for POD Data Submission- see if triggering a new full dump causes the current code to refresh the entire POD data set in the POD aggregator. 
- [ ] If yes, look into setting up a separate publishing process for local archiving of POD data on lib-jobs

Jane and I created a [decision document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1o9pAaUw4FbamU1JLVz9ldx7dNM6LRe2GxHkC8a35yqM/edit?usp=sharing) to try to come to some conclusions on some of the questions that have come up around this issue.  Contact Max or Jane if you cannot edit and want to.

Here's what I *think* is happening:
The default behavior is that when you trigger a full POD dump in Alma, the next time the cron job runs (11:30 am UTF / 7:30 am EST), it will pull in any files on lib-sftp that are in /alma/pod that match the pattern `\.tar\.gz$` that are from the last 7 days.

Many of these factors can be changed through environment variables or configuration, but that is the default behavior. 

So yes, any time you trigger a full dump as it is set up now, all those files would be sent to the POD project.

Jane and I created a [decision document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1o9pAaUw4FbamU1JLVz9ldx7dNM6LRe2GxHkC8a35yqM/edit?usp=sharing) to try to come to some conclusions on some of the questions that have come up around this issue.  Contact Max or Jane if you cannot edit and want to.
